meanings.definition: To twist about in a wriggling motion.
meanings.sent1: The toddler was squirming in her seat during the long car ride.
meanings.sent2: The fish was squirming on the hook, trying to escape.
meanings.sent3: The worm was squirming happily in the wet soil after the rain.
meanings.sent4: The snake was squirming through the narrow hole in the wall.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar was squirming as it transformed into a butterfly.

meanings.definition: To feel or display discomfort or embarrassment.
meanings.sent1: He was squirming in his chair during the awkward silence.
meanings.sent2: She was squirming with embarrassment when she tripped in front of everyone.
meanings.sent3: The comedian had the audience squirming with laughter at his jokes.
meanings.sent4: The politician was squirming under the tough questions from the reporters.
meanings.sent5: The student was squirming with nervousness before giving her presentation.
